timeline.bodyText: Many of these classes return the same thing in getRequiredFields. Consider making it a default method of EvaluationMetric
timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText:
Many of these classes return the same thing in getRequiredFields

That's true.

classification metrics (with the exception of the new AucRoc metric) require actual and predicted
regression metrics require actual and predicted
outlier detection metrics require actual and predicted probability


Consider making it a default method of EvaluationMetric

The reason I did not use default is that I didn't want to distinguish any of the analyses. I could re-introduce base abstract classes like ClassificationMetric and put the default there but I don't think it's (so far) worth it.

timeline.bodyText: Could we have a method List<QueryBuilder> EvaluationFields.buildExistsQueries()? Would that allow us to delete the explicit getters from EvaluationFields?
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText:
Could we have a method List EvaluationFields.buildExistsQueries()?

We could. I don't see much value in doing so though. EvaluationFields is a simple placeholder without any logic and there are benefits (simplicity) if it stays like this.

Would that allow us to delete the explicit getters from EvaluationFields?

No, the individual fields are still accessed in aggs methods in metrics so that metrics can build their aggregations.
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we need this validation. We already validate that all fields required by the metrics are specified. Don't those two overlap?
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText:
This validation is independent of metrics that are provided by metrics argument.
My reasoning here was that for Classification this set of fields (resultsNestedField, predictedClassNameField, predictedProbabilityField) only makes sense if all three are provided. But you may be right, such a strict check is not needed, and when there is no auc_roc in metrics, we shouldn't care which of these three fields are set.
I've removed this validation.
